member.name: T:Newegg.Framework.Web.BrowserInfoParser
member.summary: Parses a given user-agent string and builds the corresponding BrowserInfo.
member.remarks: Note to the extenders: More todo: I: there are some browsers that don't use specific identities, rather, generic agent strings are used. e.g. "Mozilla/2.02 [fr] (WinNT; I)" is actually Netscape. In these cases, we need to maintain a hashtable that matches each of these special agent strings to their real browsers. Currently we do not implement this algorithm as the above case is very rare - most modern browsers which are used on Newegg.com can be identified by a specific string. II: Some browsers have their application version that is different from the agent string, like Safari, version 2.0.3 has the agent string "Safari/417.8". If application version is vital, this feature should be added.

member.name: M:Newegg.Framework.Web.BrowserInfoParser.ParseAppVersion(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: parses the browser version from the specified position of the raw identity. returns string.Empty if no version is detected.
member.param: the position from where to start parsing the application version.

member.name: M:Newegg.Framework.Web.BrowserInfoParser.DoParseBrowserApplication(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: parses the browser application type. returns the position of the magic string in the agent string. -1 if no application is recognized.

member.name: M:Newegg.Framework.Web.Cookie.ICookieManager.CopyCookieToResponse(System.String)
member.summary: copy cookie from HttpRequest from HttpResponse. Call this function before setting any cookie value.
member.remarks:
In ASP.Net, as request cookie is not initially copied to response cookie, if we directly set a two-dimension cookie value, we may lose cookie values that are not set. For example, suppose the request cookie is "storeid=5:storetype=1", which means
cookie["storeid"]="5", cookie["storetype"]="1"
after we set the response cookie like: responseCookie["storetype"]="0", as response cookie is initally blank, the resulting cookie value will be:
"storetype=0", as can be seen, "storeid" is erased.

member.name: M:Newegg.Framework.Web.Cookie.ClassicCookieManager.CopyCookieToResponse(System.String)
member.summary: copy cookie from HttpRequest from HttpResponse. Call this function before setting any cookie value.
member.remarks:

cookie["storeid"]="5", cookie["storetype"]="1"
after we set the response cookie like: responseCookie["storetype"]="0", as response cookie is initally blank, the resulting cookie value will be:
"storetype=0", as can be seen, "storeid" is erased.

member.remarks:
